node.title: Incarceration rates in the NT have jumped 30 per cent in the past year. The Territory's top prosecutor says his office can't keep up
node.alt: The exterior of the local court in Darwin
node.description: Soaring domestic violence rates and staffing issues exacerbated by COVID are causing long delays in the Northern Territory's court system, according to itsÂ Acting Director of Public Prosecutions.
node.content:
["A former chief magistrate and lawyer of almost 40 years, Nicholas Papas QC has prosecuted and defended the worst of crimes.", "But in his short stint as the Acting Director of Public Prosecutions in the Northern Territory, the Victorian silk said he had\u00a0been \"very troubled\" by \"appalling\" rates of domestic violence.", "\"There are so many policies and programs and efforts being made to change the appalling flow of domestic violence,\" Mr Papas said.", "\"Is it making a difference? I haven't been here long enough to comment, but I can say that I'm very troubled by what I see.\"", "The NT's\u00a0Police Commissioner Jamie Chalker has said domestic violence in the NT is \"the worst it's been\" in a decade, with\u00a0officers responding to about 10,000 callouts a year.\u00a0", "Many of those police responses become prosecution files, but the Acting Director\u00a0admits that by the time his office is involved,\u00a0it's too late.", "\"We're just sweeping up,\" Mr Papas\u00a0said.\u00a0", "\"The cost of keeping one person in jail is $150,000 a year.", "\"Surely if we can reduce the imprisonment rates by getting some better management of what's going on with younger people, we can start putting that $150,000 per person into health, education, family support and so forth.\"", "", "
Mr Papas is \"troubled\" by the level of\u00a0domestic violence\u00a0in the Northern Territory.(ABC News: Melissa Mackay)
", "Australian Bureau of Statistics figures show the number of prisoners on remand in the NT\u00a0jumped by more than 30 per cent\u00a0in the 2020-2021 financial year, despite warnings the prison system was at \"tipping point\" early this year.\u00a0", "The overall prisoner population increased by 10 per cent, with the number of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander prisoners rising\u00a0from 1,371 to 1,540.", "In an effort to curb the over-representation of Indigenous people in the prison and courts systems, the NT government this year released its Aboriginal Justice Agreement, setting aside $4.52 million for the first 12 months of a seven-year framework.\u00a0", "But there is no clear funding arrangement for the life of the agreement.\u00a0", "\"The Aboriginal Justice Agreement is one small part [of tackling Indigenous incarceration rates]; local decision making is another part, education and emphasis on health [as well],\" Mr Papas said.", "Northern Territory police said COVID-19 restrictions and access to alcohol were the driving force behind soaring domestic violence rates in the past year,\u00a0and the Acting DPP says the caseload, coupled with internal staffing struggles, had\u00a0led to long delays in the Northern Territory's court system.", "\"[In July] we'd lost the director, the deputy director, a number of senior crown prosecutors \u2026 and in a space of 6-12 months a really large number of senior staff had left the office.\"", "", "
Former NT Director of Public Prosecutions\u00a0Jack Karczewski is on leave,\u00a0pending his retirement.
", "Long-time DPP Jack Karczewski QC took extended leave in June, ahead of retirement, while deputy director Matthew Nathan SC left his role to return to New Zealand.", "Senior crown prosecutor Stephen Geary was appointed judge in May, while other senior prosecutors Naomi Loudon, John Ibbotson and David Morters have also all left the office in the past two years.", "Victoria Engel was appointed Deputy Director of Public Prosecutions in June.", "Figures obtained by the ABC show between May and November 2021, Local Courts in the NT\u00a0dealt with 5,442 matters.", "Of those matters,\u00a0218 took more than 18 months to finalise or be committed to the Supreme Court.", "But during the peak of COVID-19 lockdowns in 2020, that figure was 470.", "\"In the court of summary jurisdiction, things are designed to move quickly,\" Criminal Lawyers Association NT president\u00a0Chrissy McConnell said.", "\"I wouldn't have thought that would be normal for matters to take that long to progress through the system [but] there are all sorts of pressures on agencies and services, not only because of COVID\u00a0but because of funding limitations.\"", "Ms McConnell said it had been a struggle for defence lawyers to gain access to\u00a0evidence and even their clients in prison.", "\"Accused persons are waiting in custody [so] our jails are full,\" Mr Papas said.", "", "
The number of people in NT prisons, including the Darwin Correctional Centre, has jumped in the past year.(Supplied)
", "Mr Papas said COVID-19 border closures meant lawyers were hesitant to move to the NT, with little to no opportunity to visit family interstate, and briefing interstate barristers meant forcing them into quarantine before they could appear in a NT\u00a0courtroom.", "\"My office has had to bring counsel in from outside for years \u2026 because we simply don't have enough lawyers who are qualified to do these big cases,\" Mr Papas said.", "High-profile trials, such as that of Darwin shooter Ben Hoffmann and NT police officer Zachary Rolfe, required the DPP to hire silks from New South Wales and Victoria.", "The trial of Constable Rolfe, which was originally set to run in July 2021, was delayed to allow Crown prosecutor Philip Strickland SC to quarantine at Howard Springs for two weeks.", "\"We only have a limited number of lawyers and big cases need multiple people working on them and that affects the rest of the office,\" Mr Papas\u00a0said.", "The Acting Director said he was confident things would improve, with more prosecutors coming on board and a new permanent Director of Public Prosecutions expected to be appointed before the new year.", "But Ms\u00a0McConnell said additional funding in all areas of the justice system was the only realistic answer.", "\"The delays in getting evidence to defence in order to provide informed legal advice, the ability of prosecution to respond to representations in a timely manner and therefore avoid the need for matters to be adjourned \u2026 that's what it boils down to,\" Ms McConnell said.", "Nicholas Papas QC is expected to return to Victoria in March."]
